info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 5:58PM EDT until May 23 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN EDGECOMBE AND CENTRAL HALIFAX COUNTIES... At 558 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Roanoke Rapids to 11 miles west of Scotland Neck, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Enfield, Weldon, Whitakers, South Weldon, Rosemary and Tillery. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
